page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW.
page.content: {CROWLE}IS A TOWN WITH A POPULATION OF OVER 3,000, AND IS LINKED BY THE A161 TO THE SMALL VILLAGE OF{EALAND.}BOTH THESE VILLAGES ARE SURROUNDED BY {FARMLAND}GROWING MAINLY CEREAL AND ROOT CROPS AND WITH SEVERAL OUTLYING FARMS. BUILDING IS NOT PERMITTED TO LINK EALAND AND CROWLE. ALTHOUGH CROWLE IS BUILT ON A SLIGHT HILL, MOST OF THE SURROUNDING LAND IS FLAT AND ONLY SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEA-LEVEL; RELYING TO A LARGE EXTENT ON ARTIFICIAL {DRAINAGE.}THE STAINFORTH - KEADBY {CANAL}RUNS CLOSE TO EALAND AND NOWADAYS IS MAINLY USED BY PLEASURE BOATS. ALONGSIDE IS THE DONCASTER - CLEETHORPES{RAILWAY}WHICH IS USED BY BOTH PASSENGER AND GOODS TRAINS. THERE IS ALSO A{BUS SERVICE}WHICH GIVES ACCESS TO SCUNTHORPE AND GOOLE.
